intro: Leucospermum gracile, commonly known as the slender star flower, is a South African native plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and requires well-drained conditions to thrive. Leucospermum gracile is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
